article: While eating lunch with my 4-year-old daughter this afternoon at a fast food restaurant, I noticed an old man walking to the table with a stick. The manager kindly carried the food for him. During the meal I _ the man tell a woman it was his _ . So I _ what I heard to my daughter. She loves it when people have birthdays. I told her it was OK for her to wish him a happy birthday. He _ was spending this special day alone. At first she was _ and decided against it. As I was _ our plates into the dustbin she turned to him and quietly _ him a Happy Birthday. I could tell he was _ by the way he looked at her. I went up behind her and gave him my own wishes. He was grateful.  _ we walked away he called my daughter back and _ her a brand-new gold $1 coin. She thanked him. But that wasn't enough for him. He dug into his pocket and at that I kindly told him that wasn't _ . He ignored me and _ out an envelope with about a dozen of a different kind of gold coins. He continued to give her another one and tell her how _ it was and that one day it would be worth _ . He then _ me in the eye and wished me a good day. What a kind man. I'm sure my daughter _ his day. On such  a special day, _ can I take away his glory and turn down his offering of thanks? Happy Birthday!
